etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Reports of the British Association for the Advancement of Science. From French populine from classical Latin pōpulus + French -ine

definitions: A crystalline sweet-tasting compound which occurs in the bark and leaves of the aspen, Populus tremula, and certain other poplars.

notes.text: Ppopulin is a benzyl glucoside of saligenin (o-hydroxybenyl alcohol). Formula: C₂₀H₂₂O₈.
